Package vrielynckpieterjan.masterproef.apilayer.server.fileserver

Interface FileServerInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
APILayer
public interface FileServerInterface
Interface representing the functionality of the file server part of the APILayer.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean createDirectory​(@NotNull FileServerCreateDirectoryRequest request)
    Method to create a directory.
    boolean createFile​(@NotNull FileServerCreateFileRequest request)
    Method to create a file.
    boolean deleteDirectory​(@NotNull FileServerDeleteDirectoryRequest request)
    Method to delete a directory.
    boolean deleteFile​(@NotNull FileServerDeleteFileRequest request)
    Method to delete a file.
    java.lang.String[] listDirectory​(@NotNull FileServerListDirectoryRequest request)
    Method to list the files and directories within an existing directory.
    byte[] readFile​(@NotNull FileServerReadFileRequest request)
    Method to get the content of a specified file.
    boolean writeFile​(@NotNull FileServerWriteFileRequest request)
    Method to write to a file.

  • Method Details

    • createDirectory

      boolean createDirectory​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerCreateDirectoryRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to create a directory.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerCreateDirectoryRequest instance.
      Returns:
      True if the directory was successfully created, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the file server can not create a directory at the specified location.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the file server can not create a directory at the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related problem occurred while creating the directory.

    • listDirectory

      java.lang.String[] listDirectory​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerListDirectoryRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to list the files and directories within an existing directory.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerListDirectoryRequest instance.
      Returns:
      The list as a String array.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the server could not create a list for the specified location.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the server could not find the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related exception occurred while consulting the resources.

    • deleteDirectory

      boolean deleteDirectory​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerDeleteDirectoryRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to delete a directory.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerDeleteDirectoryRequest instance.
      Returns:
      True if the directory is deleted, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the server could not delete a directory at the specified location.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the server could not find the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related exception occurred while consulting the resources.

    • createFile

      boolean createFile​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerCreateFileRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to create a file.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerCreateFileRequest instance.
      Returns:
      True if the file was successfully created, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the file server can not create a file at the specified location.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the file server can not create a file at the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related problem occurred while creating the file.

    • writeFile

      boolean writeFile​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerWriteFileRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to write to a file.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerWriteFileRequest instance.
      Returns:
      True if the file was updated; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided data could not be written to the file.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the FileServerInterface realization can not update the content of the file at the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If the FileServerInterface can not update the content of the file due to an IO-related problem.

    • readFile

      byte[] readFile​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerReadFileRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to get the content of a specified file.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerReadFileRequest instance.
      Returns:
      The content of the specified file.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided FileServerReadFileRequest instance could not be used to read an existing file.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the cloud storage service provider does not contain the specified file.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related problem occurred while consulting the content of the specified file.

    • deleteFile

      boolean deleteFile​(@NotNull @NotNull FileServerDeleteFileRequest request) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException, java.lang.IllegalStateException, java.io.IOException
      Method to delete a file.
      Parameters:
      request - The FileServerDeleteFileRequest instance.
      Returns:
      True if the file is deleted, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the server could not delete a file at the specified location.
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the server could not find the specified location.
      java.io.IOException - If an IO-related exception occurred while consulting the resources.
